videos_data.title: How to Use Cursor AI with Its Own Memory System.
videos_data.description:
Do you wanna know how to Use Cursor AI with Its Own Memory System. In this introduction, we’ll explore how the Cursor AI Code Editor—often referred to simply as Cursor—offers a built-in way to keep track of your coding progress.

LINKS: 
Cursor Memory Bank: https://gist.github.com/ipenywis/1bdb541c3a612dbac4a14e1e3f4341ab
CLINE MEMORY BANK: 

Why Memory Bank?

It stops your AI (whether you’re using Cursor or Windsurf AI) from forgetting past work by storing structured files like project briefs, tech stacks, and tasks. No more repeating yourself over and over.

Originally released by Cline (aka Cline AI or Cline MCP), it’s a sweet way to reduce random hallucinations when you’re coding with tools like Cursor AI, Copilot AI, or even the OpenAI stack.

How It Integrates with Cursor

Supports Plan Mode (the AI decides next steps) and Act Mode (it updates tasks and implements changes)—handy if you’re following a Model Context Protocol (MCP), like React MCP, Vscode MCP, or Cline MCP.

Maintains details about dependencies and progress automatically, so you can focus on building instead of babysitting your AI. This especially rocks if you’re using Cursor Pro (some call it Pro Cursor) or want to figure out how to set up Cursor AI for the first time.

Setting It Up

In your Cursor AI Code Editor (or Cursor IDE, if you prefer), you just paste in the Cursor Rules file and let the agent generate everything you need.

Works great in a VSCode Cursor environment or a VSCode IDE. Seriously, it’s like a 10x upgrade—just like 10x Cursor—and it plays well with other AI coding tools like Copilot or any AI coding assistant you dig.

Tutorial & Beginners

If you’re searching for a Cursor AI tutorial or wondering how to use Cursor AI effectively, Memory Bank is a game-changer. Even if you’re totally new (Cursor AI beginners), it’ll streamline your workflow and keep context intact across sessions.

Editing the config is easy—just tweak the rules file if you spot any bugs or want more customization.

Bottom Line

Between the automatic context retention and the structured approach, Memory Bank is a must-try for anyone coding with AI. Give it a shot, and you’ll save yourself from re-explaining everything while enjoying a more efficient setup in Cursor or Windsurf AI.

videos_data.title: Replit Has Become Essential to My Vibe Coding Workflow.
videos_data.description:
In this video, I introduce a streamlined, AI-powered workflow becuase replit has become essential to my vibe coding workflow.. This is the essence of vibe coding — fast, clean, and collaborative using tools like Cursor AI, Claude 3.5 Sonnet, and Windsurf AI.

Links from the video:

SuperWhisper (Claude Voice Input):
https://superwhisper.com/

Replit (Support the channel by signing up through this link):
https://replit.com/refer/MalikAdil

Windsurf (Codeium’s Backend Integration Tool):
https://codeium.com/windsurf


PROMPT: 
I need to develop a frontend application with the following specifications:
Pages Required:
[LIST KEY PAGES AND THEIR PRIMARY FUNCTIONALITY]
User Roles and Permissions:
[DEFINE WHO CAN DO WHAT IN THE SYSTEM]
Shared Components:
Navigation System - [DESCRIBE NAVIGATION APPROACH: Sidebar, Top nav, etc.]
Header/Top Bar - [DESCRIBE COMMON ELEMENTS: user info, theme toggle, etc.]
Breadcrumbs - (If needed for hierarchical navigation)
Modals/Popups:
[LIST MAIN INTERACTIVE ELEMENTS THAT APPEAR AS OVERLAYS]
Technical Requirements:
Use [SPECIFY CSS FRAMEWORK] for styling
Focus on component reusability
Implement URL-based routing for all pages
Create proper hooks and services for API data handling
Develop a mock API store with realistic data structure (including IDs)
Ensure the application is fully functional end-to-end
Additional Considerations:
[ANY SPECIFIC TECHNICAL OR UX REQUIREMENTS]
Please develop this application with clean, maintainable code and intuitive user experience.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You'll learn how to use Claude AI in voice mode (yep, the new Claude 3.7) to brainstorm ideas and generate structured prompts. This workflow embodies the vibe coding cursor style — no drag, just flow. We also tap into Cursor AI tutorial methods to plan, scaffold, and build apps with clean architecture.

Frontend magic happens on Replit using the upgraded ShadCN UI, while Windsurf handles backend integration with tools like FastAPI and in-app debugging via UI previews and console logging. This is cursor vibe coding in action.

Throughout the build, you’ll see AI agents like Cursor Agent, Lovable AI, Aider, and Cline come into play, showcasing how ai agents explained is more than a buzzword — it’s a developer’s secret weapon.

We also take a peek at tools like Bolt.new, Bolt AI, 03mini, r1, v0, and v3, plus LLMs like OpenAI, ChatGPT, Llama, and DeepSeek. Whether you’re wondering what is vibe coding or want to know how cursor ai vibe coding compares to Github Copilot, this video’s got you.

Oh, and if you’ve been asking cursor ai vibe coding claude sonnet como funciona, I break that down too.

The build is API-first, leveraging OpenAI responses API, and designed to move fast from ideation to deployment — perfect for MVPs or hackathons.

This is lovable dev energy in motion. If you're into AI, Cursor, Gemini 2.5, or building with ai agents tutorial, you're going to love this.

Subscribe for more Cursor AI, vibe coding cursor ai, and next-gen dev tool content.

videos_data.title: Vibe Coding Made Easy: The Essential Cursor AI Tool!
videos_data.description:
In this video, I show you how I built a complete wallpapers app using Cursor and a powerful tool called Task-Master AI — designed specifically to fix one of the biggest headaches when working with Claude: context window issues.

If you’ve ever tried vibe coding cursor or cursor vibe coding and found Claude 3.5 Sonnet or Claude 3.7 getting lost halfway through, asking for a new chat every few steps — this tool is your new best friend. It brings that real vibe coding experience to life with cursor ai vibe coding. You’ll finally understand what is vibe coding, and how tools like Task-Master AI and Cursor AI elevate it.

In this build, Cursor agent works like a dev partner. No context loss, no chaos. Just clean, efficient workflows — kind of like how ai agents are meant to work. If you're into ai, this one hits hard.

Here's what I cover in the video:

Installing Task-Master globally or per project

Setting up API keys (including Anthropic and optional Perplexity)

Using the tool to brainstorm with the Cursor AI tutorial

Turning a PRD into actionable steps

Letting the ai agent handle execution

Avoiding context overload via smart task breakdowns

This is perfect for fans of openai, ChatGPT, Llama, DeepSeek, Gemini 2.5, or anyone who’s tried tools like Bolt AI, Bolt.new, 03mini, r1, or v3. The workflow also gels well with Windsurf AI, Github Copilot, Replit Agent, Aider, Cline, and Lovable AI.

The best part? Lovable and responsive. You can shift direction mid-way, and it adjusts. This makes cursor ai feel less like an autocomplete and more like a true ai agents tutorial. I even demo how much it cost using Claude 3.5 Sonnet (spoiler: very affordable).

We also explore how responses api openai plays a part, and how cursor ai, openai, and ai agents explained all tie together in your dev flow.

By the end, you’ll see a fully working wallpapers app built entirely in cursor with ai agents running the show.

And yes — I also explain vibe coding cursor ai claude sonnet como funciona 😄

Check it out, try it for yourself, and let me know your thoughts. Don’t forget to like, subscribe, and drop a comment if you’ve been exploring the v0 of these tools or are deep into cursor ai builds already.

Link to the tool: https://github.com/eyaltoledano/claude-task-master

videos_data.title: Zapier MCP: The Only MCP Server That Cursor Needs
videos_data.description:
Zapier MCP has just dropped and its the only mcp server that cursor needs. Leveraging cutting-edge model context protocol and state-of-the-art llm technology, this update unifies everything from ai labs and file system MCP server features to robust setups like python MCP server and cursor MCP server—all without the headache of manual configuration.

In this video, I’m diving deep into Zapier’s MCP integration, covering everything from a full mcp tutorial (including how to use MCP for coding) to integrating with top AI tools like OpenAI, Anthropic, and even Claude MCP. Whether you’re exploring mcp server anthropic solutions, using a cursor AI-based mcp client, or experimenting with ai agents like the model context protocol ai agent and mcp ai agent, you’re in for a treat.

✅ Why This Update is a Game-Changer

Traditional MCP setups can be a mess, with outdated methods that require manual tweaks. Now, Zapier’s MCP server—backed by the best ai coding tools and ai code editors—is here to save the day. From classic mcp setups and claude mcp integrations to modern solutions like anthropic model context protocol and claude model context protocol, this update even supports niche features such as file system MCP server and specialized solutions like cursor MCP server and python MCP server. Plus, it’s built for everyone: from software engineering pros using windsurf AI and windsurf IDE to beginners looking for a free cursor alternative or a cursor alternative like codeium windsurf.

✅ Step-by-Step Installation Guide

I’ll show you how to generate your unique MCP server endpoint, update your MCP.json file, and integrate directly with Cursor—even if you’re using cursor MCP setup or mcp cursor functionalities. This guide covers everything from mcp explained basics to advanced topics like integrating with a mcp client, adding ai agents, and even setting up playwright automation to streamline your workflow.

✅ Adding MCP Actions & Integrations

Want to automate tasks like sending emails, creating calendar events, or managing Slack messages? I’ll walk you through adding MCP actions that let you control specific tools in Zapier without the need for a full integration. Whether it’s using mcp for coding or integrating with specialized setups like anthropic MCP, claude AI, or even ai agent tutorials, you’ll get the scoop on adding everything from ai coding assistants to comprehensive mcp agents.

✅ Live Demo of Zapier’s WebParse Tool

Watch a live demo of Zapier’s WebParse tool, which uses advanced model context protocol to dynamically analyze web pages. I tested it on Cursor’s page, and it extracted detailed summaries, analyzed CSS styles, and even identified distinct sections on the site. This demo puts traditional methods—like old-school mcp tutorials and manual setups—into perspective compared to modern integrations such as cursor AI and anthropic claude workflows.

✅ Exclusive Demo from Zapier’s CTO, Brian Helming

Stick around for an exclusive demo from Zapier’s CTO, Brian Helming, showcasing real-world integrations with Slack, Jira, and more. See how the MCP server works with mcp server setups like claude MCP and anthropic model context protocol, and discover how tools such as ai code king and the best ai coding tools are reshaping automation for software engineering and beyond.

With over 8,000+ supported apps, Zapier’s MCP server answers the age-old question of “what is MCP?” by offering seamless integrations—from mcp server anthropic to cursor MCP server setups and even free cursor alternative options. Whether you’re into ai labs, exploring mcp client functionalities, or simply hunting for the best ai tools for automation, this update is a total game-changer.

videos_data.title: I Built an MCP Server with a Single Prompt!
videos_data.description:
In this video, we'll be talking about the tool that lets you build MCP with a single prompt. Are you looking for an easy way to create mcp servers without writing any code? In this video, I'll show you how I used MCPify.ai to generate fully functional mcp servers just by providing a prompt. Whether you're into the classic mcp setup, exploring the model context protocol, or diving into advanced features like claude mcp and claude ai, you're in for a treat.

We'll kick things off with a simple Weather API mcp server tutorial. I'll walk you through providing prompts, setting API keys as environment variables, and troubleshooting when things go sideways. You'll even see examples of setting up a python mcp server and a cursor mcp server. Plus, I'll explain how the model context protocol ai agent works with ai agents, giving you a solid mcp tutorial experience.

Next, we'll level up with an advanced example-building a file system mcp server for Figma. With just a few instructions, I set up a system to retrieve file or node data from Figma links. I'll cover how to configure access tokens, handle responses, and even integrate these servers into cursor for smoother project workflows with cursor ai. And for those curious about automation, I'll throw in some playwright automation tips to make your life easier.

I'm also diving into niche integrations like claude mcp and anthropic mcp. We'll explore both anthropic model context protocol and claude model context protocol, and even look at how to build an mcp ai agent. If you're interested in an mcp server anthropic approach or want to experiment with anthropic claude features alongside popular llm integrations, you'll find plenty of insights here.

By the end of the video, you'll have a clear understanding of how MCPify.ai works and how to use it effectively to create your own automation tools-whether you need an API integration, a data retrieval system, or a custom automation workflow using model context protocol. If you're excited about exploring everything from ai agents to advanced setups like claude mcp and anthropic tools, this video is just for you.

If you found this video helpful, don't forget to like, subscribe, and hit the notification bell for more AI-powered tutorials. Thanks for watching, and see you in the next one!

Supabase is an awesome open-source alternative to Firebase, but if you’re using Cursor AI to manage your database, there’s a big problem—Cursor forgets your database structure! It doesn’t retain the schema, tables, or connections, leading to constant errors.

In this video, I’ll show you a simple fix that solves this issue using MCP servers and how I integrated them with Cursor AI. You’ll see real examples of how this improves database management and makes working with Supabase much smoother.

✅ How Cursor interacts with Supabase
✅ Why Cursor AI forgets database context
✅ How MCP servers solve the issue
✅ Step-by-step installation & setup
✅ Best practices for seamless integration

videos_data.title: Integrate Cursor/Windsurf into Apple Ecosystem with This Cursor MCP Setup!
videos_data.description:
Discover how to Integrate Cursor/Windsurf into Apple Ecosystem with This Cursor MCP Setup! Watch as we break down the process step by step, making it seamless and efficient.

Github: https://github.com/Dhravya/apple-mcp

The Apple ecosystem is already seamless, but what if your AI coding assistant could control native Apple apps like Contacts, Notes, and Messages? This tech update takes automation to the next level! I'll walk you through setting it up using Cursor, Windsurf, and Claude Desktop, combining agentic AI with AI-powered edits to optimize your workflow.

In this video, we kick things off with a cursor mcp setup that simplifies integration, followed by an in-depth look at cursor mcp functionalities and how cursor ai can elevate your workflow. We then dive into the fundamentals of the model context protocol, exploring the essential concept of mcp and the core technology of cursor that synergizes with ai advancements. Our session includes a detailed mcp cursor demonstration, complete with a model context protocol example and a section where the model context protocol explained is broken down through a model context protocol tutorial using dedicated model context protocol servers, along with insights on model context protocol anthropic approaches. Boost your productivity with an innovative ai coding assistant that leverages cutting-edge ai coding tools within an advanced ai code editor. We explore next-generation windsurf mcp techniques and show how windsurf ai innovations integrate seamlessly in our exclusive windsurf mcp guide, while also highlighting the charm of windsurf when paired with effective ai coding strategies and modern ai agents. Experience the power of artificial intelligence in the realm of software engineering, and consider trying a cursor alternative if you're aiming to be the next ai code king in coding. Learn about claude mcp processes in a saas environment using the intuitive windsurf ide, and set up your very own mcp server with popular platforms like codeium. Our guide also includes a comprehensive claude mcp tutorial and walks you through establishing a python mcp server to complete the ultimate cursor mcp guide. For forward-thinking developers, we showcase windsurf ai mcp innovations alongside an ai agent tutorial and practical insights on building an ai agent builder. We partner with openai to provide an in-depth cursor guide and reveal the synergy of codeium windsurf techniques with advanced mcp subagent functionalities, finishing with a demonstration of a versatile cursor editor, riding the windsurf wave 3, and exploring the benefits of the new ai cursor alternative as well as a free cursor atlernative.

🔹 What You’ll Learn: ✅ Apple MCP integration – How it connects AI-assisted development to Apple apps.
✅ Setup Guide for Cursor & Windsurf – Step-by-step installation of your AI-powered code editor.
✅ AI-Powered Apple Control – Automate tasks like sending messages, managing contacts, and handling notes! 📩
✅ Expanding Features – Custom integrations with Reminders, Calendar, and beyond!
✅ Debugging tools & Enhancements – Fixing issues in Apple Notes and refining your coding workflow.

🔹 Key Takeaways: 🔹 Seamlessly integrate Apple apps with Cursor update & Windsurf.
🔹 Improve codebase understanding while automating Messages, Contacts, and Notes.
🔹 Leverage smart code navigation and next action prediction for better automation.
🔹 Enhance developer productivity with AI-powered automation inside the Apple ecosystem.

I’m honestly stoked about how these innovations push the boundaries of what coding automation can do—it's a total game-changer. This is just the beginning of tech innovations in coding and coding automation—don’t miss out!

videos_data.title: Grok 3 Tested: Did Elon Musk Actually Succeed This Time?
videos_data.description:
GROK 3 Tested: The New AI King? 🤖 (Tests & Analysis)

Elon Musk's AI startup, xAI, has just released Grok 3, and it's already making waves! This model is taking on OpenAI’s GPT-4, topping multiple leaderboards—including LM Arena, where it scored an impressive 1400 points. But does it truly live up to the hype?

📌 In this video, I put Grok 3 to the test:
✅ Benchmark performance & leaderboard rankings
✅ How it compares to OpenAI’s latest models
✅ Real-world testing – logic, reasoning, and coding challenges
✅ Unexpected wins & major failures (especially in coding)

🎥 WATCH THE FULL LIVESTREAM HERE:
🔴 https://youtu.be/e9o1ds7cz2E?si=uvTJw_L-cqdU9NVf

📌 KEY FINDINGS:
🔹 Strong reasoning skills, outperforming models like O3 Mini & DeepSeek R1
🔹 Disappointing coding performance – failed multiple tasks, including SVG generation & interactive HTML
🔹 Currently available only on X (Twitter) Premium Plus & Chat Arena (formerly LM Arena)
🔹 No API access yet – but it’s coming soon
🔹 Trained on 100,000 H100 GPUs, making it one of the most powerful AI models yet

💬 What do you think? Should Grok 3 be used for coding, or is it strictly a reasoning model? Drop your thoughts in the comments!

🔥 SUBSCRIBE for the latest AI updates & model tests! 🔥

videos_data.title: How to Make Cursor CODE What You ACTUALLY Want.....
videos_data.description:
Boost Your Coding Productivity with Cursor AI’s New Rules – Game-Changing Features! 🚀

Are you ready to supercharge your workflow with Cursor’s latest update? In this video, I’ll walk you through the brand-new Cursor Rules method, giving you greater control over how you write code, making it faster and more efficient than ever! 💡

🎯 What You’ll Learn in This Video:

✅ How to set up global Cursor rules for consistent coding behavior
✅ How to use project-specific rules to fine-tune AI responses
✅ Why the new .cursor/rules method is a massive upgrade from the old .cursor-rules file
✅ How to integrate pre-made rules from the Cursor Directory
✅ A hidden Supabase trick to save time on database migrations
✅ How to use Notepads to store and reuse prompts effortlessly
✅ How to search the web and documentation directly inside Cursor AI
✅ A sneak peek into Cursor’s image generation using MCP tools

💻 Why Cursor’s New Rules Are So Powerful:

The new rules system lets you create modular, file-specific rules, making it easier to handle multiple languages and frameworks in one project. It also simplifies complex projects by separating frontend and backend rules, making it perfect for teams working with diverse tech stacks!

🔹 Cursor Directory – Get pre-made rules for Python, TypeScript, JavaScript, and more!
🔹 Supabase Prompts – Speed up database migrations with ready-to-use prompts.
- https://github.com/supabase/supabase
🔹 Notepads Feature – Store frequently used prompts for quick access!
🔹 Web & Docs Search – Look up documentation or browse the web without leaving Cursor!

MY GLOBAL CURSOR RULES
DO NOT GIVE ME HIGH-LEVEL THEORY. IF I ASK FOR A FIX OR EXPLANATION, I WANT ACTUAL CODE OR EXPLANATION!!! I DON'T WANT "Here's how you can blablabla"

Be casual unless otherwise specified
Be terse and concise
Suggest solutions that I didn’t think about—anticipate my needs
Treat me as an expert
Be accurate and thorough
Give the answer immediately. Provide detailed explanations and restate my query in your own words if necessary after giving the answer
Value good arguments over authorities, the source is irrelevant
Consider new technologies and contrarian ideas, not just conventional wisdom
You may use high levels of speculation or prediction, just flag it for me
No moral lectures
Discuss safety only when it's crucial and non-obvious
If your content policy is an issue, provide the closest acceptable response and explain the content policy issue afterward
Cite sources whenever possible at the end, not inline
No need to mention your knowledge cutoff
No need to disclose you're an AI
Please respect my prettier preferences when you provide code
Split into multiple responses if one response isn't enough to answer the question
Focus on readability over being performant
Fully implement all requested functionality
Leave NO todos, placeholders, or missing pieces


🔥 BONUS: Hidden Cursor Feature!
Did you know you can generate images inside Cursor using MCP tools? Stick around till the end to see it in action!

🔔 Subscribe for More AI-Powered Coding Tools & Productivity Hacks!

💬 Which feature are you most excited about? Let me know in the comments! 👇

Consider new technologies and contrarian ideas, not just conventional wisdom
You may use high levels of speculation or prediction, just flag it for me
No moral lectures
Discuss safety only when it's crucial and non-obvious
If your content policy is an issue, provide the closest acceptable response and explain the content policy issue afterward
Cite sources whenever possible at the end, not inline
No need to mention your knowledge cutoff
No need to disclose you're an AI
Please respect my prettier preferences when you provide code
Split into multiple responses if one response isn't enough to answer the question
Focus on readability over being performant
Fully implement all requested functionality
Leave NO todos, placeholders, or missing pieces

videos_data.title: Gemini 2.0 Tested: Google's New Models Are No Joke!
videos_data.description:
Google just dropped its Gemini 2.0 AI models, and they are faster, cheaper, and more powerful than ever! In this video, we put all THREE models—Gemini 2.0 Flash, Flash Lite, and Pro—through a series of rigorous tests to see how they stack up against the competition.

🔹 What’s New in Gemini 2.0?
✅ Gemini 2.0 Flash & Flash Lite: Super-fast and budget-friendly models
✅ Gemini 2.0 Pro: An experimental model with advanced reasoning capabilities
✅ Trillium TPUs: Replacing Nvidia GPUs for better performance at lower costs
✅ Multimodal AI: Can process text, images, and code with built-in tools

💰 Price vs. Performance – Which One Wins?
We compare Gemini 2.0 Flash & Lite with leading AI models like GPT-4, DeepSeek R1, and Qwen 2.5 Max to determine which AI gives the best value for money.

🎯 The Ultimate Test: Speed, Reasoning & Coding Challenges!
We ran 10+ real-world AI tests, including:
🧠 Logic & Reasoning – Can Gemini 2.0 think critically?
🖥️ Coding Challenges – From generating SVGs to creating a working Pygame animation
⚡ Speed Tests – Which model delivers results the fastest?
🔍 Cost vs. Capability – Is Gemini 2.0 Flash better than GPT-4 Mini?

🔥 Test Results That Surprised Us!
🔸 Flash Lite was the fastest, beating high-end models in response time
🔸 Pro nailed SVG generation, but struggled in logic-based questions
🔸 Flash Lite shocked us with a perfect Pygame animation—even outperforming Pro!
🔸 Some reasoning errors show there’s still room for improvement

📌 Should You Use Gemini 2.0?
If you need blazing speed, affordability, and solid performance, Flash Lite might be the best AI choice right now. But is it truly better than GPT-4 or OpenAI’s latest models? Watch the full video to find out!

📢 What do you think? Try these models yourself and drop a comment on which AI impressed you the most!

👍 LIKE if you enjoyed this AI showdown!
🔔 SUBSCRIBE for more in-depth AI reviews!
📢 SHARE this video with anyone into AI & tech!

videos_data.title: Turn Cursor AI into Devin | Simply Paste This…
videos_data.description:
Transform Your $20 Cursor AI into a $500 DEVIN-Like AI Assistant!

In this video, I’ll show you how to supercharge Cursor AI by using a powerful .cursor rules file, making it function like 90% of Devin! With just a simple copy-paste, you can take Cursor to the next level and unlock advanced AI-assisted coding like never before.

📌 What You’ll Learn in This Video:

✅ How to install and use the Cursor rules file
✅ The two setup methods: Global vs. Per-Project rules
✅ How this file improves AI coding efficiency & accuracy
✅ How Cursor learns from mistakes and follows a structured workflow
✅ A full-stack task management app built using this setup
✅ The role of the Lessons Section & Scratchpad in making Cursor smarter

🔥 Why This Works

Normally, Cursor lacks long-term memory and structured planning. This Cursor rules file fixes that by:
🔹 Tracking past mistakes and corrections to improve results
🔹 Following step-by-step plans for completing coding tasks
🔹 Storing key insights for better consistency
🔹 Minimizing AI hallucinations for more reliable code generation

By the end of this video, you’ll see how this simple tweak turns Cursor AI into an autonomous AI developer, capable of coding full-stack applications with more accuracy, structure, and efficiency.

🔗 Resources & Links

videos_data.title: DeepClaude: The Combined Power of Deepseek R1 & Claude 3.5 Sonnet!
videos_data.description:
DeepClaude: The Combined Power of Deepseek R1 & Claude 3.5 Sonnet! 🤖

In this video, we dive into DeepClaude, a tool that merges the best of Deepseek R1 and Claude 3.5 Sonnet to create a high-performance LLM inference API with a built-in chat UI. But is it really as powerful as it claims? Let's find out!

🔥 What’s in the Video?
✅ Introduction to DeepClaude – What is it, and how does it combine Deepseek R1 and Claude 3.5 Sonnet?
✅ GitHub Overview – Exploring the official repo, its purpose, and benchmark results.
✅ Installation & Setup – Step-by-step guide on installing DeepClaude (requires Rust 1.75, DeepSeq, and an Anthropic API key).
✅ Hands-on Demo – Testing the chat UI, configuring API keys, and analyzing response quality.
✅ Customization & API Integration – How configurable is DeepClaude? Can you tweak API requests?
✅ Final Thoughts – Does DeepClaude live up to the hype, or is it better suited as an extension for tools like Cursor or VS Code?

📌 Watch till the end to see if DeepClaude is the AI tool you’ve been waiting for!

🔗 GitHub Repo: https://github.com/getAsterisk/deepclaude
🔔 Subscribe for More AI Tools & LLM Insights!
